metadata.title: CVE-2016-8405 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability in kernel components including theION subsystem, Binder, USB driver and networking subsystem could enable alocal malicious application to access data outside of its permissionlevels. This issue is rated as Moderate because it first requirescompromising a privileged process. Product: Android. Versions: Kernel-3.10,Kernel-3.18. Android ID: A-31651010.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
No subscription required
